body_html:
This is a deliberate change. Before 1.0, we have very few guarantees for the API itself. In fact, we're trying to make breaking changes before 1.0, so their frequency may increase in the coming months.

Please take a look at our policy regarding code.

For stored graphs, the guarantees are stronger.

After 1.0, there should not be breaking changes in minor releases, only for major ones (i.e., the next ones at 2.0).

Note that regardless of version, development at head (or branch head) is inherently dangerous when it comes to stability due to bugs.

After 1.0, there should not be breaking changes in minor releases, only for major ones (i.e., the next ones at 2.0).
Note that regardless of version, development at head (or branch head) is inherently dangerous when it comes to stability due to bugs.
body:
This is a deliberate change. Before 1.0, we have very few guarantees for the API itself. In fact, we're trying to make breaking changes before 1.0, so their frequency may increase in the coming months. 

Please take a look at [our policy](https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.10/resources/versions.html) regarding code. 

For stored graphs, the guarantees are [stronger](https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.10/resources/data_versions.html). 

After 1.0, there should not be breaking changes in minor releases, only for major ones (i.e., the next ones at 2.0).

Note that regardless of version, development at head (or branch head) is inherently dangerous when it comes to stability due to bugs.
